data.output: In the mysterious post-apocalyptic land of "Mechanica" there was a severe shortage of petrol. The robots were starting to squeak at the hinges, and the leaders of Mechanica were starting to panic. They heard through the digital grapevine that there may be a way to drill and pump for a new type of digital diesel called "Digisel". However, their usual digital hacker (a robot named Bill) was pretty much keeling over thanks to the petrol shortage, and the codes to access the mystery digital product were looking to be inaccessible.

Once upon a time there was a retired postman called Edward. Over the years he had become obsessive with collecting stamps. One day he was at a retired postperson convention and he met other stamp collecting enthusiasts. He made a good friend in retired postwoman Sarah, and she showed him a brilliant stamp which seemed to have a moving face (of an ostrich) thanks to the silver holographic effect. They decided to stay in touch by letter to discuss their stamp collections and trade their weird and wonderful stamps. At Christmas Sarah decided to send Edward a letter with a special gift; she had sourced one of the rare ostrich stamps for him. Edward was delighted and decided to frame it.

There once was a very strange land called Augmentia. It was an empire that had been created by dictators and was an island based off of the coast of Argentina. Word travelled fast that the dictators - namely Putinito - had begun an organ trafficking trade. The people of Augmentia, unbeknownst to them, had been born on the island and brainwashed into the ways of the land. When a citizen of Augmentia reached the age of 20, they were enlisted into a type of military boot camp where they had to comply with strict instructions and a gruelling regime of work, exercise, and weapons training. Those who did not comply with instructions, or tried to rebel against the bootcamps leaders, were never seen again by their families. It has been an enduring mystery where the rebels ended up, and Putinito had a mysterious ob

Wendy was extremely distressed. She had returned home from work to a pile of letters, and she looked with some dismay at the first letter with a red banding. Gloom descended across her face when she realised that she owed a payment to a holiday company; she had forgotten to pay her deposit. Wendy wondered why debt collection companies had to exist, so she decided to pack up her belongings and instead went backpacking.
